protocol.description: The transient seat protocol can be used by clients to create independent seats that will be removed when the client disconnects. The client also gets a handle to the seat which can be used to remove the seat.

request.name: create
request.description:
Create a new seat that is removed when the client closes the connection.
The client may suggest a name for the seat, but the server may choose whichever name it sees fit, except the name must not collide with the name of another seat.
It is suggested that the client choose a sufficiently unique name, e.g. something containing the pid and an incremental numeric value.

entry.name: name_taken
entry.summary: The suggested name was already taken

entry.name: invalid_name
entry.summary: The suggested name contains invalid characters

event.name: failed
event.description: This event indicates that the seat creation failed. No event is generated after this and the client should destroy the transient seat object.

event.name: ready
event.description: This event indicates that the seat has been created and tells the client which name was chosen for it. It is generated after the seat is created. No event is generated after this.
